title: Sharp trace asymptotics for a class of 2D-magnetic operators
abstract: In this paper we prove a two-term asymptotic formula for for the spectral counting function for a 2D magnetic Schrödinger operator on a domain (with Dirichlet boundary conditions) in a semiclassical limit and with strong magnetic field. By scaling, this is equivalent to a thermodynamic limit of a 2D Fermi gas submitted to a constant external magnetic field. The original motivation comes from a paper by H. Kunz in which he studied, among other things, the boundary correction for the grand-canonical pressure and density of such a Fermi gas. Our main theorem yields a rigorous proof of the formulas announced by Kunz. Moreover, the same theorem provides several other results on the integrated density of states for operators of the type (−ih∇−μA)^2 in L^2(Ω) with Dirichlet boundary conditions.
